items.title: Boeing expects $4 billion loss for fourth quarter after chaotic 2024

items.title: Shares of cash-strapped Nikola nosedive on report of potential sale
items.content: Nikola warned investors on its third-quarter conference call that the company only had enough cash to support its business into the first quarter of 2025.
items.contentSnippet: Nikola warned investors on its third-quarter conference call that the company only had enough cash to support its business into the first quarter of 2025.

items.title: UnitedHealthcare taps company veteran Tim Noel as new CEO following Brian Thompson killing
items.content: Noel was the head of Medicare and retirement at UnitedHealthcare, the largest private health insurer in the U.S. and the insurance arm of UnitedHealth Group.
items.contentSnippet: Noel was the head of Medicare and retirement at UnitedHealthcare, the largest private health insurer in the U.S. and the insurance arm of UnitedHealth Group.

items.title: AI-enhanced films 'The Brutalist' and 'Emilia Pérez' score Oscar nominations for acting, editing
items.content: "The Brutalist" and "Emilia Pérez," two films facing controversy over artificial intelligence usage, lead the nominees for the Academy Awards.
items.contentSnippet: "The Brutalist" and "Emilia Pérez," two films facing controversy over artificial intelligence usage, lead the nominees for the Academy Awards.

items.title: Store closures hit highest level since pandemic — see who is shutting down the most locations
items.content: The trend reflects the divide between retailers gaining market share, such as Walmart, and those that have lost ground or filed for bankruptcy, like Big Lots.
items.contentSnippet: The trend reflects the divide between retailers gaining market share, such as Walmart, and those that have lost ground or filed for bankruptcy, like Big Lots.

items.title: Airlines flex pricing power, signaling higher fares in 2025

items.title: A norovirus vaccine could be on the horizon as cases rise
items.content: Moderna is testing a norovirus vaccine in a phase three trial. Results could be available as soon as this year.
items.contentSnippet: Moderna is testing a norovirus vaccine in a phase three trial. Results could be available as soon as this year.

items.title: Adidas to cut up to 500 jobs after posting better-than-expected holiday profits
items.content: Adidas plans to cut as many as 500 jobs at its corporate headquarters in Germany in a bid to simplify its business—not to cut costs.
items.contentSnippet: Adidas plans to cut as many as 500 jobs at its corporate headquarters in Germany in a bid to simplify its business—not to cut costs.

items.title: Shein exec says tariffs shouldn't affect its cheap clothes — as long as they're applied 'equally'

items.contentSnippet: When asked if Shein will still be able to provide its ultralow prices if tariffs take effect, Tang did not address whether the company would raise prices.

items.title: CNN announces about 200 layoffs as it attempts to modernize business

items.title: Family offices are paying executive assistants up to $190,000 a year as demand for talent spikes

items.contentSnippet: The talent war between family offices and Wall Street has driven up salaries not only for top investment roles but also for administrative staff.

items.title: Retail crime 'queenpin' to pay millions in restitution to Ulta, other retailers for theft ring
